package.name: Net_Nmap
package.summary: A simple wrapper class for the Nmap utility
package.description:
Net_Nmap is a simple interface for Nmap, the free and open source utility for network exploration or security auditing.
Net_Nmap can be used to auto discovery hosts and services in your network or simply to parse Nmap XML output.
Note: Requires a Nmap installation on your system. Nmap is available from http://nmap.org/
package.notes: - Changed. By default nmap scan is performed without any parameters. - Added. The enableOptions() method to Nmap class to set Nmap parameters. - Changed. The Os detection flag was removed as option in the constructor. - Updated. Tests and examples.

release.notes: Revised release for PEAR Proposal. - The escapeshellcmd() is used to escape all data that can be passed to the command line. - The $options (associative array) can be passed to the constructor to set runtime properties. - The __get and __set methods are used to set properties in the Service object.
Revised release for PEAR Proposal. - Using PEAR_Exception instead of PEAR_Error - Fixed typo in the initialization of $_properties in the Service class

- replaced is_null($foo) with $foo === null - use get and set method for the status property - renamed os() to getOS() - renamed allOS() to getAllOS() - use Exception instead of trigger_error in the Service class. - using visibility in all code. - Use System::which() to find the nmap binary instead of hardcoding the path into the class. - In the examples use count() instead of $object->count() - Use tempnam() instead of md5() in Nmap::scan() to avoid conflicts - In Parser.php a link to the nmap xml format docs was added. - The parser and the other classes are unit-tested - More Shell escaping in Nmap::_createCommandLine() (output file, target) - In Nmap::parseXMLOutput() the original PEAR_Error is passed to the exception - The package works now on windows - The failed to resolve hostnames/IPs are now reported.

- Changed. By default nmap scan is performed without any parameters. - Added. The enableOptions() method to Nmap class to set Nmap parameters. - Changed. The Os detection flag was removed as option in the constructor. - Updated. Tests and examples.
